title: Adduser Command
content: Adduser Options Adduser Examples  Add a New User Add a User With Default Directory Add a User With a Primary Group Add a User With a Supplementary Group Add a User Without Home Directory Create a System Account Add User With a Default Login Shell      Adduser Options      -d: Directory Path -g: Primary Group Name -G: Supplementary Group Name -M: No Home Directory -r: System User -s: Shell Path  Adduser Examples     Add a New User     sudo adduser username Add a User With Default Directory     sudo adduser -d /directory/path username Add a User With a Primary Group     sudo adduser -g groupname username Add a User With a Supplementary Group     sudo adduser -G admin username Add a User Without Home Directory     sudo adduser -M username Create a System Account     sudo adduser -r mike Add User With a Default Login Shell     sudo adduser -s /bin/bash mike

title: FFMPEG
content: Videos  Stream Copy Copy Video and Reencode Audio Re-encode Video and Copy Audio Re-encode Both Video and Audio Re-encode And Downsize Video Re-encode With Constant Rate Factor Re-encode And Downsize Video with Nvidia Encoder/Decoder   Audio  7.1/5.1 Channels Audio Downmix to AAC 2.0 General Audio Downmix to AAC 2.0 Covert Ape To Flac Convert Alac to Flac Split Flac Files With Cuebreakpoints      Videos     Stream Copy     ffmpeg -i input -map 0 -c copy output.mkv Copy Video and Reencode Audio     ffmpeg -i input.ts -c:v copy -c:a aac output.mp4 Re-encode Video and Copy Audio     ffmpeg -i input.ts -c:v libx264 -c:a copy output.mp4 Re-encode Both Video and Audio     ffmpeg -i input.ts -c:v libx264 -c:a aac output.mp4 Re-encode And Downsize Video     ffmpeg -i input.ts -c:v libx264 -s 720x480 -c:a copy output.mp4 Re-encode With Constant Rate Factor     ffmpeg -i input.ts -c:v libx264 -crf 18 -c:a aac output.mp4 Re-encode And Downsize Video with Nvidia Encoder/Decoder     ffmpeg -y -vsync 0 -hwaccel cuda -hwaccel_output_format cuda -i input.ts -c:v h264_nvenc -resize 1280x720 -cq:v 26 -c:a copy output.mp4 Audio     7.1/5.1 Channels Audio Downmix to AAC 2.0     ffmpeg -i source.mkv -map 0:v:0 -c:v:0 copy -map 0:a:0 -c:a:0 aac -b:a:0 256k -filter:a:0 "pan=stereo|FL=1.414*FC+0.707*FL+0.5*FLC+0.5*BL+0.5*SL+0.5*LFE|FR=1.414*FC+0.707*FR+0.5*FRC+0.5*BR+0.5*SR+0.5*LFE,acompressor=ratio=4" -map 0:a:0 -c:a:1 copy -map 0:s:0 -c:s:0 copy -map 0:s:1 -c:s:1 copy -map 0:s:2 -c:s:2 copy output.mkv General Audio Downmix to AAC 2.0     ffmpeg -i source.mkv -map 0:v:0 -c:v:0 copy -map 0:a:0 -c:a:0 aac -b:a:0 256k -ac:a:0 2 -map 0:a:0 -c:a:1 copy -map 0:s:0 -c:s:0 copy -map 0:s:1 -c:s:1 copy -map 0:s:2 -c:s:2 copy output.mkv Covert Ape To Flac     ffmpeg -i source.ape output.flac Convert Alac to Flac     for file in *.m4a; do ffmpeg -i "$file" -f flac "`basename "$file" .m4a`.flac"; done Split Flac Files With Cuebreakpoints     cuebreakpoints file.cue | shnsplit -o flac file.flac

title: Find Command
content:
Find Files Using Name in Current Directory Find Files Under Home Directory Find Files Using Name and Ignoring Case Find Directories Using Name Find all txt Files in the Directory Find Files With 777 Permissions Find Files With 777 Permissions and Chmod to 644 Find and Remove Multiple Files Find All Empty Directories Find All File Based on User Find all Files Based on Group Find Size between 50MB – 100MB Find and Delete 100MB Files Find Last 50-100 Days Modified Files Find Modified Files in Last 1 Hour    Find Files Using Name in Current Directory     find . -name foobar.txt 
Find Files Under Home Directory     find /home -name foobar.txt 
Find Files Using Name and Ignoring Case     find /home -iname foobar.txt 
Find Directories Using Name     find / -type d -name foobar 
Find all txt Files in the Directory     find . -type f -name "*.txt" 
Find Files With 777 Permissions     find . -type f -perm 0777 
Find Files With 777 Permissions and Chmod to 644     find / -type f -perm 0777 -exec chmod 644 {} + 
Find and Remove Multiple Files     find . -type f -name "*.txt" -exec rm -f {} + 
Find All Empty Directories     find /tmp -type d -empty 
Find All File Based on User     find / -user root 
Find all Files Based on Group     find /home -group developer 
Find Size between 50MB – 100MB     find / -size +50M -size -100M 
Find and Delete 100MB Files     find / -type f -size +100M -exec rm -f {} + 
Find Last 50-100 Days Modified Files     find / -mtime +50 –mtime -100 
Find Modified Files in Last 1 Hour     find / -mmin -60

title: Hard Disk Information
content:
smartctl lshw lsblk blkid hdparm fdisk with grep    smartctl     sudo smartctl -i /dev/sdx 
lshw     The tool lshw provides detail information on the hardware configuration of the machine. Additional flags (ie class) can be used to filter output.  sudo lshw -short -class disk sudo lshw -short -class disk -class storage 
lsblk     lsblk /dev/sdx 
blkid     blkid 
hdparm     sudo hdparm -I /dev/sda 
fdisk with grep     fdisk -l | grep '^Disk /dev/' fdisk -l | grep '^Disk /dev/' | egrep -v '/dev/(loop|mapper|md)'

title: NFS Share
content:
NFS Config File List Available NFS Share Re-Export NFS Share NFS Options    NFS Config File     /etc/exports 
List Available NFS Share     exportfs -v 
Re-Export NFS Share     exportfs -r 
NFS Options     Squash means to destroy the power of the remote root user   ro = read-only rw = read write root_squash = prevents remote root users from having superuser (root) priviledges on remote NFS-mounted volumes. no_root_squash = allows root user on the NFS client host to access NFS-mounted directory with the same rights and priviledges that the superuser would normally have.

title: Useradd Command
content: Useradd Options Useradd Examples  Creating a User With Specific Home Directory Creating a User With Specific User And Group ID Creating a User And Assign Multiple Groups Creating a User with Specific Login Shell Creating a System User      Useradd Options      -m: Create Home -d: Directory Path -u: User ID -g: Group ID -G: Secondary Groups Comma Separated -s: Login Shell Path -r: System User  Useradd Examples     Creating a User With Specific Home Directory     sudo useradd -m -d /opt/username username Creating a User With Specific User And Group ID     sudo useradd -u 1500 username Creating a User And Assign Multiple Groups     sudo useradd -g users -G wheel,developers username Creating a User with Specific Login Shell     sudo useradd -s /usr/bin/zsh username Creating a System User     sudo useradd -r username

title: Usermod Command
content: Usermod Options Usermod Examples  Change User Home Directory Change User Primary Group Adding Group to an Existing User Change User Login Name Move User Home Directory to New location Change User Shell Change User and Group ID For User      Usermod Options      -d: Directory Path -g: Primary Group -G: Adding Supplementary Group to Existing User -l: New Login -d: Directory Path -m: Home Directory -s: Shell Path  Usermod Examples     Change User Home Directory     sudo usermod -d /var/www/ username Change User Primary Group     sudo usermod -g groupname username Adding Group to an Existing User     sudo usermod -G supgroup username Change User Login Name     sudo usermod -l new_username username Move User Home Directory to New location     sudo usermod -d /directory/path -m username Change User Shell     sudo usermod -s /bin/sh username Change User and Group ID For User     sudo usermod -u 888 -g 999 username
